sources.title: The Woman Between
sources.description: * Released: 1931-08-08* Drama (Eng USA) * RKO Radio Pictures* RCA Photophone * PRODUCER: William LeBaron * DIRECTOR: Victor Schertzinger * WRITER: Howard Estabrook (Screenplay) * CINEMATOGRAPHY: J. Roy Hunt * EDITOR: William Hamilton * STARRING: Lili Damita (Julie), Lester Vail (Victor), O.P, Geggie (John), Miriam Seegar (Doris), Anita Louise (Helen), Ruth Weston (Mrs. Black), Lincoln Stedman (Buddy), Blanche Friderici (Mrs. Weston), William Morris (Frederick), Halliwell Hobbes (Barton) * SUMMARY: Returning home after along absence, man discovers the woman he fell in love with on the ship home, is actually his stepmother. * SOURCE: 1) MrFilmschatten 2) This Film 3) Wikipedia * I own no part of this film; I have uploaded for Educational purposes only. Doreen (def gp ddh)

sources.title: The Woman Between 1931 Lili Damita, Lester Vail, O.P. Heggie, Miriam Seegar
sources.description: The Woman Between 1931 Lili Damita, Lester Vail, O.P. Heggie, Miriam Seegar

metadata.Plot: Julie Whitcomb and Paul Niles meet and fall in love on the ship returning them from Europe. But once in New York, where Julie owns a boutique, she tries to break off their romance, telling Paul she's married. At the same time, Julie's stepdaughter, Doris, plans a welcome home party for her brother, Victor, after his extended absence. He left in a huff when his father, John, planned to marry shortly after his mother died, and never met the intended bride. When Julie joins the party, both are shocked when they see each other. It seems that Victor changed his name to Paul Niles and Julie was known as Madame Julie, the name of her boutique, so they had no idea when they met they were stepmother and stepson. They continue their deception, but Doris guesses the truth when she catches Victor lying about the ship he came in on. She writes a letter to her father telling all, but Julie gets hold of the note. Victor has asked her to meet him at the pier for a ship going back to Europe, and now John tells her he bought her a villa on the Riviera where they can both retire to. Torn between both her loves, she first asks John to read the letter Doris wrote.
metadata.Actors: Lili Damita, Lester Vail, O.P. Heggie
